Product: Extra Butter Curl Forming Creme, 8 oz
Title: Great Hold and Moisture
Review: This product is great for my 4c hair.  I used to avoid creams (only using hair mousse or gels) for twisting my hair because it would leave white flakes.  This product does not flake and it has made my two-strand twist look better than before.  I do not have to constantly re-twist my hair at night.  So, the product has a great hold and it also offers superb moisture.  This add so much more moisture than any mousse or gel I've ever used.  In addition to this cream, I am going to purchase additional products from this line.

Product: Extra Butter Curl Forming Creme, 8 oz
Title: No more sticky residue
Review: I finally found a hair product that doesn't cause a sticky build up. My daughter has lots of thick hair. I can use this on her hair daily, without that sticky buildup. It has a nice light scent and you can use it on dry or damp hair. I love it and will buy more .

Product: Extra Butter Curl Forming Creme, 8 oz
Title: Thick, moisturizing, and also great for wavy/looser curls
Review: I have mostly 2C hair that forms larger ringlets and deep waves, but it's INCREDIBLY frizzy and dry, so I usually find I get better results with thicker products, and just use less of them. Bought this to use with the Curly Magic and LOVE the combination. This creme is super thick and rich, so I usually grab a dime size, work into one side, another dime size, work into the other size, and a third that I gently scrunch in while my hair is upside down, before applying the Curly Magic.The results initially while drying felt semi-stiff, but were easily scrunched out while drying without causing too much frizz, and settled into some really nice, soft curls that didn't feel weighed down or overly rough, which sometimes happens with my hair when the products don't have enough moisture. The hold is softer, so after a day or two, the frizz creeps back in, but overall, this helped give a lot of shape and moisture that held up well over several days and was refreshed easily. I literally just touched up with roots with some water after shaking my hair out of the cap and was able to just go.Definitely recommend!

Product: Supercurl 8 Ounce
Title: Wouldn't buy again for type 4 hair but still love the brand
Review: I had such high hopes for this product because I use the curly magic gel and I'm addicted to it. I'm pretty dissapointed to say the least as the product has absolutely no slip. My hair usually loves soybean oil but the combo in this mixture was a bit off balance. When applied to my hair it was way too much water that did nothing to my har but after twisting my hair my hands were quite greasy so looks like the oil transferred to my hands and not really to my hair. I've used it on wet and on dry hair (type 4) with still no good results. I'll still purchase other products in this line but this was a waste of money and it's quite expensive on Amazon.

Product: Supercurl 8 Ounce
Title: Increased moisture, softness and definition on 3rd day hair!
Review: I have 4C hair. I used "Supercurl" on a damp, third day, twa UFD "Curly Magic" wash n' go just as an experiment, and I was pleasantly surprised with the results. It revived my wash n' go and extended it for a full 3 days. The moisturization and softness were better than good, but it was the shine and definition that really impressed me. Uncle Funky's Daughter "Curly Magic" and "Supercurl" (and throw in some "Glossy" for good measure) really made a difference in the look and feel of my hair.

Product: Supercurl 8 Ounce
Title: Uncle Funky's Daughter
Review: This product is very moisturizing and provides a great hold during Twisting process. I wish all the Uncle Funky's products were more readily available at retail stores.

Product: Supercurl 8 Ounce
Title: Great Moisturizer for Twist Outs
Review: This is a wonderful product. I started using the Curly Magic in this line over a year ago to trap water i my hair and had great results, so I'm not surprised that this product is just as good with moisturizing. My hair was recently in braids and was very dry when I took them out. The second time I washed my hair I put Curly Magic on right after rinsing out my conditioner then blow dried my hair with a diffuser. A few days later this product arrived. I used it to put my hair in twists for a twist out. When I took my twists out the volume and definition was gorgeous (I have 4b hair) and my hair was totally supple and moisturized without feeling greasy or frizzing up from too much moisture. Will definitely purchase again.

Product: Supercurl 8 Ounce
Title: ALWAYS READ LABELS. Do not be hoodwinked by "natural" presentation and clever marketing.
Review: At first it seemed to work well. But my hair became increasingly dry each day of use. Looked at ingredients and saw alcohol and sulphates. Threw out 2/3 Of the jar.

Product: Supercurl 8 Ounce
Title: Know what you're reading...
Review: I've only used this once but I really wanted to respond to some other comment about alcohols and sulfates. I did not see a single sulfate in the ingredients list, the alcohol listed is cetaryl alcohol which is a fatty alcohol. NOT a drying alcohol and is beneficial for the hair. It's always good to read labels but don't assume that all alcohols or sulfates are bad. I use a curly girl method on my hair that cuts out harmful sulfates, silicones, drying alcohols and mineral oils and this stuff is safe and smells amazing. My hair loves it today but it's the first day of use so I can't comment on long term use! I wish I could have simply replied to the other comment but am unable to. :(Ingredients list from website:SUPERCURL FULL INGREDIENTS LISTWater, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Glycerin, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Honey, Polymide-1, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter), Fragrance, Cetearyl Alcohol, Ceteareth-20, Glyceryl Stearate, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Macadamia Ternifolia (Macadamia) Seed Oil, Potassium Hydroxide, Xanthan Gum, Carbomer, Tetrasodium EDTA, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Potassium Sorbate, Caramel.

Product: Supercurl 8 Ounce
Title: Non-Greasy Moisture
Review: This was a nice surprise! I've had this for over a year in a travel/try it kit. I tried the Extra Butter, but it's too heavy for my hair. I have fine strands, and highly porous Afro-textured hair. When I try to refresh with water-based products, my hair frizzes out, so I try not to do it, and usually my products cooperate for 3-4 days. I don't like to rewet my hair to refresh either (but sometimes you have to do it ). It's been really dry over the summer, so I've been experiencing more dryness than usual.Anyway, this moisturizer works really well with Thirsty Curls and Curly Magic as a refresher. I had to refresh my canopy, and I'm always hesitant to do it, but it worked out! Once it dried, my curls/waves were clumped back together, and I had a nice non-greasy, soft, but firm hold.  This product contains glycerine, which can usually make a product sticky also, but no stickiness (that comes when I put the gel over it). There were no fly-aways or that weird frizz one can get when you try to refresh. This will work well until I get ready to shampoo.After those results, I had to order the full size (I always have the 32 oz Curly Magic gel on hand because it is my favorite). You don't have to use a ton of product. I would say with Thirsty Curls, you shouldn't use a lot because it tends to suds/bubble, but once you put the Curly Magic over it, it calms down. Seems tricky to use, but it's worth it. Don't be heavy handed. Step 1) Refresh with Thirsty Curls (not too much), 2) Apply Supercurl, and 3) Curly Magic (or gel of choice).

Product: Shining Star Hair & Scalp Elixir, 6 oz
Title: Too thick with a strong smell.
Review: The struggle is real when trying to get the oil out of the bottle. Either the oil is too thick or the owner could benefit from switching to a bottle with an actual applicator, like the one the Camille Rose brand has for their Buriti hair oil. To be honest, UFD products really are for people with 4C hair types. I am not sure why the other hair types are still listed since all formulas seemed to have changed to mostly alcohol-based and silicone. This is one of few without alcohol, but so many different oils give it a weird smell. But yeah, if you buy this hair elixir, you're going to have to unscrew the cap to apply the oil.

Product: Shining Star Hair & Scalp Elixir, 6 oz
Title: Wonderful for hair and skin!
Review: I love this oil it's a slightly thicker oil but it's not greasy.  No scent great ingredients I use on my hair, scalp, skin and for hot oil treatments in my 4C hair!
